{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Netgear |model=DGND3700 |revision=v2 |upc= |ean= |asin= |price= |est_release_date= |fcc_date=04/24/2012 |manuf_country=China |manuf=SerComm |manuf_model= |manuf_rev= |availability= |type=wireless router,dsl modem |fcc_id=PY311400180 |ic_id= |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=2.5 |pwr_conn=barrel |pwr_barrel_inner= |pwr_barrel_outer= |pwr_barrel_len= |pwr_vac= |pwr_pol= |pwr_poe= |cpu1_brand=Broadcom |cpu1_model=BCM6361 |cpu1_cspeed=400 |cpu2_brand= |cpu2_model= |cpu2_cspeed= |fla1=32 |fla1_brand= |fla1_model= |fla1_num= |fla2= |fla2_brand= |fla2_model= |fla2_num= |ram1=64 |ram1_brand= |ram1_model= |ram1_num= |ram2= |ram2_brand= |ram2_model= |ram2_num= |expansion_if_types=Mini PCIe (half),USB 2.0 |expansion_pcmcia_num= |expansion_expresscard_num= |expansion_minipci_num= |expansion_minipcie_num=1 |expansion_usb_num=2 |jtag= |serial= |wi1_module= |wi1_module_if=Mini PCIe (half) |wi1_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi1_chip1_model=BCM43228 |wi1_chip2_brand= |wi1_chip2_model= |wi1_chip3_brand= |wi1_chip3_model= |wi1_802dot11_protocols=an |wi1_ant_conn=U.FL |wi1_txchains=2 |wi1_rxchains=2 |wi1_sstreams=2 |wi2_module= |wi2_module_if= |wi2_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi2_chip1_model=BCM6361 |wi2_chip2_brand= |wi2_chip2_model= |wi2_chip3_brand= |wi2_chip3_model= |wi2_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi2_ant_conn= |wi2_txchains=2 |wi2_rxchains=2 |wi2_sstreams=2 |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip1_brand= |eth_chip1_model= |eth_chip2_brand= |eth_chip2_model= |eth_chip3_brand= |eth_chip3_model= |sw_cpu= |sw_brand=Broadcom |sw_model=BCM53125 |lan_speed=1G |lan_ports=4 |wan_ports= |flags= |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=abgn |default_ssid= |default_ssid_regex= |default_ip=192.168.0.1 |default_user=admin |default_pass=password |oui= |oui_eth= }} ''N600 Wireless Dual Band Gigabit ADSL2+ Modem Router''
{{SupportPage|vendor=NETGEAR|model=DGND3700|vs_id=20194}} This device uses BCM6361 (non-DECT BCM6362). The part number visible in the FCC photos is BCM6361UKFEBG. "ABL00F-1.6" is silkscreened on the main board. "ABL00N0B-1.0" is silkscreened on the wireless module in the FCC photos. Default SSIDs '''NETGEAR''' and '''NETGEAR-5G'''?
